Description: Ostracon, fragment (four pieces joined - incorporating 1923,0327.413) of the body of a buff-coloured pottery vessel, the exterior is widely grooved and covered with a cream-coloured slip and remains of fourteen lines of Coptic text written in black ink, now very worn in places, containing part of a letter.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.99-100)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87607) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87607)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 109 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
